title: Better image scaling. No more jaggies for downscaled images!
body: Responsive websites typically send a larger version of an image and then scale it down to match the available space on-screen. This is especially important in mobile when the user can change screen sizes without a reload by changing from portrait to landscape, for example. Even the Microsoft websites utilize this kind of responsive design.

comments.body: I run an art site, Inkbunny, where we regularly have 4K-to-8K artwork displayed in a "wide" mode with width:100% scaling. This is great except that Edge's resizing is aliased and actually falls over sometimes without any error message (just showing a blank white image).

Yes, it is not quite clear to me why support for CSS image-rendering has been set to low priority on https://dev.windows.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/status/?filter=f3f0000bf&search=image-rendering
